concept-wr.title: Accelerated Virtual Interfaces
concept-wr.shortdesc: VNFs can be configured to use accelerated virtual ports (AVP) that improve throughput when compared to emulated virtual drivers (example, e1000).

conbody.draft-comment: [pedro] Other than the documentation on the SDK doc, there is no detailed work flow in the TIS docs about setting up the AVP-KMOD and AVP-PMD interfaces.
[pedro] For detailed information on this topic we would need to extract the content from the SDK README files and make it available into this document.
conbody.p: Titanium Server AVP virtual NIC is a shared memory based high performance networking device. Its potential maximum throughput is higher than other emulated virtual NIC devices (for example, e1000).
Titanium Server AVP Linux kernel device driver is delivered as source with the required makefiles in a compressed tarball, such that it can be compiled as an external kernel module.
